intro: Wahlenbergia nana, commonly known as the dwarf bellflower, is a small, herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of only a few centimeters, with hairy stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from blue to purple, bloom in early spring and are often clustered at the tips of the stems. Wahlenbergia nana thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
